Author: Kyoto Dream Trips
Review:
2020 is the "Year of the Rat", Large Ema at Various Shrines in Kyoto.
Rat is the first in the 12-year-cycle of Chinese zodiac signs. People born in the year of rat are generally born with the zodiac rat characteristics. They are believed to be very industrious and thrifty, diligent and positive. They love to enshrine and collect. They have a keen intuition and can foretell the danger. They can deal with the money carefully and have a good financial luck. Large Ema depicting the "Year of the Rat" at Go≈ç Shrine, across from the Imperial Palace on Karasuma Dori, in Kyoto City-Japan.

Author: Onur G√úNG√ñR
Review: Go-o Jinja Shrine is located to the west of Kyoto Imperial Palace and on the opposite side of Karasuma Street. Enshrined deities are Wake no Kiyomaro who prevented a famous political conspiracy of Dokyo and devoted himself to developing the foundation of the Heian-kyo capital with his older sister Wake no Hiromushi. Originally Wake no Kiyomaro was enshrined at the location of Jingo-ji Temple on Mt. Takao, but later was relocated to the current site by the order of the Emperor Meiji in 1886. It enshrines the deity of legs. The legend says that when Kiyomaro met difficulties on the way to Usa Hachiman, 300 boars appeared and helped him travel to the destination, and his legs were cured. Therefore many people who wish to have healthy legs visit this shrine, including professional athletes. Sacred karin (quince) tree grows in the locality.  It is said that karin wine is made from the fruit that brings a benefit of relieving asthma. At the Inoko Festival, court events are reenacted. It is held on every 1st of November and the shrine precinct will be filled with a festive atmosphere.

Review: Adjacent to Kyoto Gyoen, it can be visited along with the surrounding attractions. It is a shrine that enshrines Prince Wake no Kiyomaro and his older sister, Princess Hiromushi, and is called Inoshishi Shrine, just like Go'o Shrines all over Japan. It is said to bring benefits for the health of the legs and the recovery from illness, and it is also said that there is a benefit for child rearing, since Princess Hiromushi took care of an orphan in Kyoto. In November, the Boar's Child Festival is held. It is also famous that this deity was enshrined on the Imperial Japanese Navy cruiser Takao. You can get a goshuin at the shrine office.

Review:
It is famous for its shrines that are good for wild boars and legs, but it is also a sacred place for Kankore, and is also the origin of the shrine on the ship of the former Imperial Japanese Navy heavy cruiser "Takao".
There are various ornaments and signboards from outside the precincts of the shrine that make it hard to decide, but what Kancolle and warship fans are looking for is the "Kaohsiung" goods in the showcase on the left side after entering the precincts. In addition to genuine designs and photographs, models and manuals have been donated by volunteers and former crew members. It is a shrine that announces something.
The same-type ship Atago is also nearby (at the top of Mt. Atago in Arashiyama), so why not stop by while sightseeing in Kyoto?

Wake no Kiyomaro, whose name was changed to Shimaro and Samushi and sent to a rural area because he tried to correct Dokyo's lie in the Usa Jingu Shrine false oracle incident, and his older sister, Princess Wake no Hiromushi, are enshrined. It is Lord Kiyomaro was a great figure who decided Kyoto as the location of Heian-kyo, who advised that Kyoto was suitable as the capital of Japan, and Princess Hiromushi is known for having built Japan's first orphanage.
